events.location: Oak Hill Bible Church, Austin, TX
events.title: The Book of Judges – Austin, Texas
events.description:
WHO:        All ages (No advance registration required)
DATE:        Sunday mornings
TIME:        10:30 AM–12:00 PM
WHERE:    Oak Hill Bible Church, Austin, Texas
 

Join Pastor Armstrong in an in-depth study of the book of Judges. Though few Christians study the book end to end, most recognize the book's iconic characters, including Samson, Gideon, and Deborah. Judges bridges the 300-year period between Moses and Joshua and the kings of Israel, when every tribe of Israel acted as nation unto itself. This is a book filled with heros, villains, love, war, miracles and God's grace. No wonder the book of Judges is a favorite source for classic Sunday school stories.

The study is conducted from the pulpit as part of the Oak Hill Bible Church Sunday services, held at 10:30 A.M. every Sunday morning. The church is located in the Oak Hill area of southwest Austin, Texas.  No advance registration is required, and free childcare is available.

For more information, please contact VBVMI.

events.title: 1Samuel – San Antonio, Texas
End Times Seminar - Tullahoma, TN
events.description:
WHO:        Everyone 12yrs and older
DATE:        February 4-5, 2016
TIME:        Thursday, 6:00 - 9:30 PM
                  Friday, 6:00 PM - 9:30 PM
WHERE:    Faith Bible Fellowship
                  411 S. Anderson St. 
                  Tullahoma, TN 37388 

Join us for a short but powerful seminar on one of the most exciting and important books of the Bible, the book of Revelation.

Pastor Armstrong will teach his popular End Times seminar covering the important highlights of our Revelation Bible study, including the basis for Tribulation, the return of the Lord for His Church, the meaning and sequence of other end times events, and an understanding of God's purpose in bringing about these events according to scripture. 

The seminar will be held at the Faith Bible Fellowship in Tullahoma, Tennessee. No advanced registration is required for this free event. For more information, please call 615-812-8283 or email the event coordinator, Pastor Greg Driver.

events.title: Ambassador Seminar - Oslo, Norway
events.description:
WHO:        All ages (No advance registration required)
DATE:        February 20, 2016
TIME:        Saturday, 10:00–14:00          
WHERE:    Strommen, Norway
                  (Details TBA)


The Great Commission is a call to be a witness and a disciple. How do we answer that calling? What does a true disciple look like and how can we be bold to share our faith with a culture that may oppose our efforts? Pastor Stephen Armstrong and Jerry Dyke, Board member of VBVMI, will address the biblical perspectives on being an ambassador for Christ and disciplining those we reach. This is a packed 4-hour presentation offering practical ways individual Christians can fulfill this calling.

Our seminar will be held on only one day, Saturday, February 20, 2016, in Strommen, Norway (exact location to be announced soon). The event begins at 10:00 and ends by 14:00. Join us for a special time of Bible teaching, dialog and Q&A with uniquely insightful and experienced Bible teachers. 



For more information, please contact our Director of Western Europe, Ottar Graasvoll, by phone at +47 469 09 925 or by an email.

events.title: Discipleship Seminar - Washington St.
events.description:
WHO:        All ages (No advance registration required)
DATE:        March 11-12, 2016
TIME:        Friday TBD
                  Saturday TBD          
WHERE:    Dungeness Community Church
                  45 Eberle Ln, Sequim,
                  Sequim, WA 98382


The Great Commission is a call to discipleship. Why are we called to disciple? How do we answer that calling? What does a true disciple look like? Pastor Stephen Armstrong will address the Biblical perspectives on discipleship together with practical ways individual Christians can fulfill that calling. 

Our seminar will be held over two days, March 11-12, 2016, at Dungeness Community Church in Sequim, Washington. Specific times for the event will be announced shortly. Join us for a special time of Bible teaching, dialog and Q&A with a uniquely insightful Bible teacher. 

For more information, please contact the event coordinator, Cara, by phone at 360-683-7501 or by an email.

ProgramFriday, March 11, 2016

6:00 PM – Discipleship Part I
8:00 PM – Q&A


Saturday, March 12, 2016

8:30 AM – Light Breakfast (provided)
9:00 AM – Discipleship Part II
10:00 AM – Break
10:15 AM – Discipleship Part III
11:30 AM – Lunch (meal not provided)
1:00 PM – Discipleship Part IV
2:15 PM – Break
2:30 PM – Wrap up and Q&A

events.location: Auckland Bible Church – Auckland, New Zealand
events.title: Revelation Seminar - Auckland, NZ
events.description:
WHO:        All ages (No advance registration required)
DATE:        August 18-20, 2016
TIME:        Thursday, August 18th at 7:00–9:00 P.M.
                  Friday, August 19th at 7:00–9:00 P.M.
                  Saturday, August 20th, 9:00 AM–12:00 PM.
WHERE:   Auckland Bible Church
                 300 Great South Road Greenlane
                  Auckland, New Zealand
 

Auckland Bible Church in Auckland, New Zealand, is hosting a weekend seminar on one of the most exciting and important books of the Bible, the book of Revelation.

The seminar will cover the important highlights of our Revelation Bible study, including the basis for Tribulation, the timing of certain end times events according to scripture, and an understanding of God's purpose in bringing about these events. 

If you are in New Zealand, we hope you will join us! For more information, please
call (+64) 09 523 4350 or email us.

events.title: 2016 VBVMI Bible Conference
events.description:
WHO:        Ages 12 and up (Registration opens in Spring 2016.)
DATE:        October 13-15, 2015
TIME:        TBA
WHERE:    Village Parkway Baptist Church
                  3002 Village Pkwy, San Antonio, TX 78251
COST:       FREE to all participants.  

 

ABOUT THE 2016 VBVMI BIBLE CONFERENCE

The theme for the 2016 VBVM Bible Conference is Ambassadors for Christ: Witnessing in Times of Persecution.

More information about our conference program will be announced in early 2016 and registration will open in Spring 2016. We hope you can join us for this important and timely program.
